page.title: 13NEW INDUSTRY IN SHILDON
page.content: Since the closure of the British Rail Wagon Works in 1983-84 over 50% of the population are unemployed.New factory units have been set up, some of them on the site of the Works, which was demolished and the tracks taken up.These include Shildon Forge. The vacant buildings of Shildon Co.Junior school were converted to Training Workshops with reduced rents and other incentives for people to set up there own businesses.One success from these has been a school leaver who set up a computer software business and has had so much demand for his business systems that he has moved to a new factory unit. Direct Worktops,a firm set up by a local businessman 7 years ago, is moving into purpose-built premises on the outskirts of Shildon costing Â£6m.This factory will create some new jobs for the area.
